name: Pickthall
text: Sad. By the renowned Qur'an,

name: Pickthall
text: Nay, but those who disbelieve are in false pride and schism.

name: Pickthall
text: How many a generation We destroyed before them, and they cried out when it was no longer the time for escape!

name: Pickthall
text: And they marvel that a warner from among themselves hath come unto them, and the disbelievers say: This is a wizard, a charlatan.

name: Pickthall
text: Maketh he the gods One Allah? Lo! that is an astounding thing.

name: Pickthall
text: The chiefs among them go about, exhorting: Go and be staunch to your gods! Lo! this is a thing designed.

name: Pickthall
text: We have not heard of this in later religion. This is naught but an invention.

name: Pickthall
text: Hath the reminder been unto him (alone) among us? Nay, but they are in doubt concerning My reminder; nay but they have not yet tasted My doom.

name: Pickthall
text: Or are theirs the treasures of the mercy of thy Lord, the Mighty, the Bestower?

name: Pickthall
text: Or is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them theirs? Then let them ascend by ropes!

name: Pickthall
text: A defeated host are (all) the factions that are there.

name: Pickthall
text: The folk of Noah before them denied (their messenger) and (so did the tribe of) A'ad, and Pharaoh firmly planted,

name: Pickthall
text: And (the tribe of) Thamud, and the folk of Lot, and the dwellers in the wood: these were the factions.

name: Pickthall
text: Not one of them but did deny the messengers, therefor My doom was justified,

name: Pickthall
text: These wait for but one Shout, there will be no second thereto.

name: Pickthall
text: They say: Our Lord! Hasten on for us our fate before the Day of Reckoning.

name: Pickthall
text: Bear with what they say, and remember Our bondman David, lord of might, Lo! he was ever turning in repentance (toward Allah).

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! We subdued the hills to hymn the praises (of their Lord) with him at nightfall and sunrise,

name: Pickthall
text: And the birds assembled; all were turning unto Him.

name: Pickthall
text: We made his kingdom strong and gave him wisdom and decisive speech.

name: Pickthall
text: And hath the story of the litigants come unto thee? How they climbed the wall into the royal chamber;

name: Pickthall
text: How they burst in upon David, and he was afraid of them. They said: Be not afraid! (We are) two litigants, one of whom hath wronged the other, therefor judge aright between us; be not unjust; and show us the fair way.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! this my brother hath ninety and nine ewes while I had one ewe; and he said: Entrust it to me, and he conquered me in speech.

name: Pickthall
text: (David) said: He hath wronged thee in demanding thine ewe in addition to his ewes, and lo! many partners oppress one another, save such as believe and do good works, and they are few. And David guessed that We had tried him, and he sought forgiveness of his Lord, and he bowed himself and fell down prostrate and repented.

name: Pickthall
text: So We forgave him that; and lo! he had access to Our presence and a happy journey's end.

name: Pickthall
text: (And it was said unto him): O David! Lo! We have set thee as a viceroy in the earth; therefor judge aright between mankind, and follow not desire that it beguile thee from the way of Allah. Lo! those who wander from the way of Allah have an awful doom, forasmuch as they forgot the Day of Reckoning.

name: Pickthall
text: And We created not the heaven and the earth and all that is between them in vain. That is the opinion of those who disbelieve. And woe unto those who disbelieve, from the Fire!

name: Pickthall
text: Shall We treat those who believe and do good works as those who spread corruption in the earth; or shall We treat the pious as the wicked?

name: Pickthall
text: (This is) a Scripture that We have revealed unto thee, full of blessing, that they may ponder its revelations, and that men of understanding may reflect.

name: Pickthall
text: And We bestowed on David, Solomon. How excellent a slave! Lo! he was ever turning in repentance (toward Allah).

name: Pickthall
text: When there were shown to him at eventide lightfooted coursers

name: Pickthall
text: And he said: Lo! I have preferred the good things (of the world) to the remembrance of my Lord; till they were taken out of sight behind the curtain.

name: Pickthall
text: (Then he said): Bring them back to me, and fell to slashing (with his sword their) legs and necks.

name: Pickthall
text: And verily We tried Solomon, and set upon his throne a (mere) body. Then did he repent.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: My Lord! Forgive me and bestow on me sovereignty such as shall not belong to any after me. Lo! Thou art the Bestower.

name: Pickthall
text: So We made the wind subservient unto him, setting fair by his command whithersoever he intended.

name: Pickthall
text: And the unruly, every builder and diver (made We subservient),

name: Pickthall
text: And others linked together in chains,

name: Pickthall
text: (Saying): This is Our gift, so bestow thou, or withhold, without reckoning.

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! he hath favour with Us, and a happy journey's end.

name: Pickthall
text: And make mention (O Muhammad) of Our bondman Job, when he cried unto his Lord (saying): Lo! the devil doth afflict me with distress and torment.

name: Pickthall
text: (And it was said unto him): Strike the ground with thy foot. This (spring) is a cool bath and a refreshing drink.

name: Pickthall
text: And We bestowed on him (again) his household and therewith the like thereof, a mercy from Us, and a memorial for men of understanding.

name: Pickthall
text: And (it was said unto him): Take in thine hand a branch and smite therewith, and break not thine oath. Lo! We found him steadfast, how excellent a slave! Lo! he was ever turning in repentance (to his Lord).

name: Pickthall
text: And make mention of Our bondmen, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, men of parts and vision.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! We purified them with a pure thought, remembrance of the Home (of the Hereafter).

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! in Our sight they are verily of the elect, the excellent.

name: Pickthall
text: And make mention of Ishmael and Elisha and Dhu'l-Kifl. All are of the chosen.

name: Pickthall
text: This is a reminder. And lo! for those who ward off (evil) is a happy journey's end,

name: Pickthall
text: Gardens of Eden, whereof the gates are opened for them,

name: Pickthall
text: Wherein, reclining, they call for plenteous fruit and cool drink (that is) therein.

name: Pickthall
text: And with them are those of modest gaze, companions.

name: Pickthall
text: This it is that ye are promised for the Day of Reckoning.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! this in truth is Our provision, which will never waste away.

name: Pickthall
text: This (is for the righteous). And lo! for the transgressors there with be an evil journey's end,

name: Pickthall
text: Hell, where they will burn, an evil resting-place.

name: Pickthall
text: Here is a boiling and an ice-cold draught, so let them taste it,

name: Pickthall
text: And other (torment) of the kind in pairs (the two extremes)!

name: Pickthall
text: Here is an army rushing blindly with you. (Those who are already in the Fire say): No word of welcome for them. Lo! they will roast at the Fire.

name: Pickthall
text: They say: Nay, but you (misleaders), for you there is no word of welcome. Ye prepared this for us (by your misleading). Now hapless is the plight.

name: Pickthall
text: They say: Our Lord! Whoever did prepare this for us, oh, give him double portion of the Fire!

name: Pickthall
text: And they say: What aileth us that we behold not men whom we were wont to count among the wicked?

name: Pickthall
text: Did we take them (wrongly) for a laughing-stock, or have our eyes missed them?

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! that is very truth: the wrangling of the dwellers in the Fire.

name: Pickthall
text: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): I am only a warner, and there is no Allah save Allah, the One, the Absolute,

name: Pickthall
text: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Mighty, the Pardoning.

name: Pickthall
text: Say: It is tremendous tidings

name: Pickthall
text: Whence ye turn away!

name: Pickthall
text: I had no knowledge of the Highest Chiefs when they disputed;

name: Pickthall
text: It is revealed unto me only that I may be a plain warner.

name: Pickthall
text: When thy Lord said unto the angels: Lo! I am about to create a mortal out of mire,

name: Pickthall
text: And when I have fashioned him and breathed into him of My Spirit, then fall down before him prostrate,

name: Pickthall
text: The angels fell down prostrate, every one,

name: Pickthall
text: Saving Iblis; he was scornful and became one of the disbelievers.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: O Iblis! What hindereth thee from falling prostrate before that which I have created with both My hands? Art thou too proud or art thou of the high exalted?

name: Pickthall
text: He said: I am better than him. Thou createdst me of fire, whilst him Thou didst create of clay.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Go forth from hence, for lo! thou art outcast,

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! My curse is on thee till the Day of Judgment.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: My Lord! Reprieve me till the day when they are raised.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Lo! thou art of those reprieved

name: Pickthall
text: Until the day of the time appointed.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Then, by Thy might, I surely will beguile them every one,

name: Pickthall
text: Save Thy single-minded slaves among them.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: The Truth is, and the Truth I speak,

name: Pickthall
text: That I shall fill hell with thee and with such of them as follow thee, together.

name: Pickthall
text: Say (O Muhammad, unto mankind): I ask of you no fee for this, and I am no simulating.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! it is naught else than a reminder for all peoples

name: Pickthall
text: And ye will come in time to know the truth thereof.
